intro: Rumex pycnanthus, commonly known as narrowleaf dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows in moist or wet environments such as marshes, stream banks, and damp woodlands. The plant features dark green, lance-shaped leaves with a prominent central vein and a rough, hairy surface. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Rumex pycnanthus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types, including clay and loam.
